revised_title: On Internal Resistance, Internal Friction in Fluids, and Theories of Sound and Auscultation
tldr: The author investigates the effects of internal resistance and internal friction in fluids, particularly in relation to sound propagation and auscultation. He presents equations for the transmission of sound through a column of air, taking into account the compressibility of air and the impact of internal resistance and friction. The author also discusses the role of the ear in detecting sound, suggesting that only aerial rarefactions can stimulate the human ear.
